title: Did a urine worker get fired because of the voter's suspension in the "black life" shirts?
subtitle: Tennessee's laws prohibit campaign slogans on clothing in polls, but does BLM count?
author: Nur Ibrahim
vclaim: In October 2020, a staff member at a polling station in Memphis, Tennessee, was expelled for his interest in the first voters wearing "black life" shirts and other relevant languages, and asked to remove the letters.
